case.name: Slaveski v Rotstein & Associates Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 1428 (7 December 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: application to reinstate pursuant to rule 16.05(2)
application to set aside bankruptcy notice
not initially pursued by party affected
party objecting ordered to pay costs.
whether debtor should pay petitioner's cost where debt paid and petition dismissed
whether refusal of debtor's offer was reasonable
debtor entitled to costs only up until when offer was refused.
instalment order made on judgment debt
whether hearing of creditor's petition should be adjourned

citances.sentence: The cost judgment was upheld by the Supreme Court of Victoria on 3 April 2009: Slaveski v Rotstein & Associates Pty Ltd [2009] VSC 111. Slaveski applied to set aside the bankruptcy notice but that application was dismissed on 17 November 2008 by Registrar Luxton. An application by Slaveski to set aside that dismissal was rejected by Burchardt FM on 6 May 2009: Slaveski v Rotstein & Associates [2009] FMCA 443. An appeal from the decision of Burchardt FM was dismissed by Marshall J on 7 December 2009: Slaveski v Rotstein & Associates Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 1428.
